name: csv-feed
label: CSV Feed
description:
CSV Feed can be used to fetch Threat Intel Feeds from a csv file from any Publicly hosted url or from FortiSOAR Attachment/File.

This connector has a dependency on the Threat Intel Management Solution Pack. Install the Solution Pack before enabling ingestion of Threat Feeds from this source

Server URL.title: Server URL
Server URL.name: server_url
Server URL.tooltip: IP address or hostname of the server to which you will connect and collect Threat Intel Feeds
Server URL.description: IP address or hostname of the server to which you will connect and collect Threat Intel Feeds

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Feeds from URL
operations.description: Retrieves the Threat intel Feeds found on the config Server URL based on the column names and other parameters provided

parameters.title: Column Name
parameters.name: col_name
parameters.description: Specify the comma separated value of the Column names that you want to retrieve
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma separated value of the Column names that you want to retrieve

parameters.title: Delimiter
parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: Specify the Single byte character to use as separator in the csv file
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Single byte character to use as separator in the csv file

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of Feeds to fetch, per page. By default, this option is set as 100
parameters.name: n_rows
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of Feeds to fetch, per page. By default, this option is set as 100

operations.title: Get Feeds from Attachment
operations.description: Retrieves the Threat intel Feeds found on the FSR Attachment/File based on the column names and other parameters provided

parameters.title: Reference ID
parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Specify the Reference IRI of the FSR Attachment/File
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Reference IRI of the FSR Attachment/File

parameters.title: Process Response As
parameters.name: process_response_as
options: Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR
parameters.tooltip: Select the method of returning the Feed Data information. You can choose between the data being created as "Feed records" in FortiSOAR (the Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR option) or data being returned in the JSON format (the Return as a JSON option).
parameters.description:
Select the method of returning the Feed Data information. You can choose between the data being created as "Feed records" in FortiSOAR (the Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR option) or data being returned in the JSON format (the Return as a JSON option). 
If you choose the 'Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR' option, then in the Record Creation Playbook IRI field, specify the IRI of the playbook that creates feed records in FortiSOAR.

Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR.title: Record Creation Playbook IRI
Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR.description: Specify the IRI of the playbook that creates feed records in FortiSOAR.
Create as Feed Records in FortiSOAR.name: create_pb_id

parameters.title: Column Name
parameters.name: col_name
parameters.description: Specify the comma separated value of the Column names that you want to retrieve. If left blank, All columns will be returned
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma separated value of the Column names that you want to retrieve. If left blank, All columns will be returned

parameters.title: Delimiter
parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: Specify the Single byte character to use as separator in the csv file
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Single byte character to use as separator in the csv file

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of rows to fetch, per page
parameters.name: n_rows
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of rows to fetch, per page
